alert.note: Alert for Chouteau; Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 8:03PM MDT until June 26 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Chouteau and Hill. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen between 7 pm and 8 pm. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area between 8 pm and 9 pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kenilworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
